result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas J. Kuruc appeared with Attorney William Michel.  Defendant in custody.  Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the Prosecution.  Agent Jacqueline Gatlin in court.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Case is dismissed and read-in with 15CF112, 15CF356, 15CF357 & 15CM243 on State's motion.
Drug Court

Per ADA Tracey Braun, def. has been accepted into the Drug Court program.  Status conf. in Br. 8 on 2/10/16 at 9:30 is removed from the calendar.  Plea and sentencing in Br. 4 scheduled for 2/10/16 at 3:15.  Parties notified by email.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty William Michel.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. has an assessment today to see if he qualifies for participation in the Drug Court.  Status conf. 2/10/16 at 9:30.  Bond continued.
At the request of ADA Emily Trigg and Atty William Michel, FPT set for today is adj. to 1/21/16 at 10:30.

NO RECORD TAKEN:    Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Attorney William Paul Michel appeared.   Clerk: PT
Parties met in chambers and court approved Atty Michels request for an adjournment to follow up with drug court.  FPT on 12/3/15 at 10:20 AM.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney William Michel.  Clerk: PT
Atty Michel requests an adjournment due to additional discovery and has issues to discuss with ADA Trigg.  Court grants one final adjournment.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 10:20 am.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared specially for Atty Trigg and for the State.    Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney William Michel. Clerk: PT
Atty Michel states DE is currently enrolled in the Living Free Program and is expected to complete it on 10/6/15.  Atty Michel requests a 30 day adj. to check DE's eligibility for Drug Treatment Court since he is not eligible for Behavioral Court; no objection by the State.  Status conference scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney William Michel.  Clerk: PT
Atty Michel states a new offer has been received and requests an adjournment to discuss offer further.  Atty Michel states DE is also looking to get into a 6 month treatment at Wheaton.  Arguments heard on DE's bond motion and upon hearing arguments motion to modify bond is denied by the court.  FPT on 8/6/15 at 10:00 AM.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney William Michel.  Clerk: PT
Atty Michel states he is waiting for additional discovery and requests an adjournment at this time.  Atty Michel also requests bond motion be held in abeyance at this time.  FPT on 7/10/15 at 9:30 AM.
received from Defendant, copy to both attys 6/2/15

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Attorney William Paul Michel appeared on behalf of defendant who is in custody and appearance is waived for today.  Clerk: PT
Atty Michel requests a new date as DE has new charges scheduled for an initial this Friday; no objection by the State.  FPT adj. to 6/19/15 at 9:40 AM.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Thomas J. Kuruc, appeared with Attorney William Paul Michel.  Clerk: PT
Atty Michel states DE was recently released from an inpatient treatment and requests an adjournment to allow DE time to complete an application for drug court; no objection by the State.  Status Conf. on 5/5/15 at 10:30 AM.
